sn12.59:4.2: “There are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, consciousness is conceived.
sn12.59:4.3: Consciousness is a condition for name and form. …
sn12.59:4.4: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.59:5.1: Suppose there was a great tree.
sn12.59:5.2: And its roots going downwards and across all draw the sap upwards. …
sn12.59:5.3: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, consciousness is conceived. …
sn12.59:6.1: There are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, consciousness is not conceived.
sn12.59:6.2: When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. …
sn12.59:6.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.59:7.1: Suppose there was a great tree.
sn12.59:7.2: Then a person comes along with a spade and basket. …
sn12.59:7.3: In this way the great tree is cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
sn12.59:7.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, consciousness is not conceived.
sn12.59:7.5: When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. …
sn12.59:7.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
